data.title: Verizon Communications - M&A Summary and Business Overview
data.meta_description:
Verizon Communications has acquired 37 companies, including 6 in the last 5 years. A total of 10 acquisitions came from private equity firms. It has also divested 13 assets.
                Verizon Communications’ largest acquisition to date was in 2000, when it acquired GTE for $64.7B. It’s largest disclosed sale occurred in 2015, when it
                        sold Verizon Communications - Wireline Operations in California Florida and Texas to Frontier Communications Parent for $10.5B. Verizon Communications has acquired in 15 different US states, and 3 countries. The Company’s most targeted sectors include communications (39%) and  information technology (21%).
data.text:
Verizon Communications M&A Summary

Verizon Communications has acquired 37 companies, including 6 in the last 5 years. A total of 10 acquisitions came from private equity firms. It has also divested 13 assets.

Verizon Communications’ largest acquisition to date was in 2000, when it acquired GTE for $64.7B. It’s largest disclosed sale occurred in 2015, when it sold Verizon Communications - Wireline Operations in California Florida and Texas to Frontier Communications Parent for $10.5B. Verizon Communications has acquired in 15 different US states, and 3 countries. The Company’s most targeted sectors include communications (39%) and information technology (21%).

Verizon Communications Business Overview
